decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the following drawings / document title number(s): LOCATION PLAN; 2CR/100 (EXISTING FLOOR PLANS); 2CR/101 (EXISTING ELEVATIONS); 2CR/102 (LOCATION PLAN); 2CR/300/H REV H (PROPOSED FLOOR PLANS); 2CR/301/H REV H (PROPOSED ELEVATIONS); 2CR/302 (PROPOSED SITE PLAN)
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building, unless otherwise stated in the submitted application form or approved drawings.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the host property and local area, in accordance with Policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021), Policies 7.4 and 7B of Adopted Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013) and the Ealing Local Plan 2022 (Reg 19).

| The proposed window on the side elevation of the two-storey side extension at first floor level hereby approved shall at no time be openable or glazed, otherwise than in obscured glass, below a minimum height of 1.7 metres above the relevant floor level.
Reason: To ensure that the proposed development does not prejudice the amenities of adjoining occupiers, in accordance with Policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).
| No part of the flat roof of the hereby approved development shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof terrace/garden or similar amenity area.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties and future occupiers of the development, in accordance with Policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).
description: Single story rear/side wrap around extension; part first floor side extension; front porch extension; and associated internal and external alterations
